content.title: Bronchiectasis
content.summary: Chronic irreversible dilation of bronchi due to inflammation and infection, causing chronic productive cough, recurrent infections, and hemoptysis
key_points: Permanent bronchial dilation from chronic inflammation
Chronic productive cough with purulent sputum
Causes: post-infectious, cystic fibrosis, immune deficiency, ABPA
CT chest shows bronchial dilation, signet ring sign
Treatment: airway clearance, antibiotics for exacerbations, treat underlying cause

statement.text: Chronic irreversible dilation of bronchi due to inflammation and infection, causing chronic productive cough, recurrent infections, and hemoptysis

explanation.intuition: Understanding Bronchiectasis is essential for clinical practice.
explanation.technical_details: Chronic infection and inflammation damage bronchial walls, destroying elastic and muscular components. This creates a vicious cycle: impaired mucociliary clearance leads to bacterial colonization, which perpetuates inflammation.

pathophysiology.mechanism: Chronic infection and inflammation damage bronchial walls, destroying elastic and muscular components. This creates a vicious cycle: impaired mucociliary clearance leads to bacterial colonization, which perpetuates inflammation.

imaging.ct_chest: Bronchial wall thickening, dilation (inner diameter > adjacent artery), signet ring sign

treatment_options.airway_clearance: Chest physiotherapy, oscillating devices, hypertonic saline

antibiotics.exacerbations: Treat based on sputum cultures; often Pseudomonas

treatment_options.treat_underlying: Immunoglobulin for CVID, itraconazole for ABPA
